text.__SUMMARY__: Stejneger's beaked snake (Letheobia stejnegeri) is a species of snake in the family Typhlopidae. The species is endemic to Middle Africa (Democratic Republic of the Congo and Republic of the Congo).
text.Etymology: The specific name, stejnegeri, is in honor of Leonhard Hess Stejneger, Norwegian-born American herpetologist at the Smithsonian Institution for over 60 years.
text.Further reading: Loveridge A (1931). "A new snake of the genus Typhlops from the Belgian Congo". Copeia 1931 (3): 92-93. (Typhlops stejnegeri, new species).
